comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: This is a photo of a US Air Force McDonnell Douglas F-4C (F-4C-19-MC) Phantom (USAF Ser. No.  63-7569, Construction Number c/n 582)  which overran the runway at Cam Ranh Bay in the Republic of Vietnam (South Vietnam) in or about 1965.  This F-4 Phantom would eventually be repaired and serve with the US Air Force well into the mid-1980s (sent to the AMARC "boneyard" on March 12, 1987 as "FP0045").
